intro: Epilobium × prantlii, commonly known as the common willowherb, is a hybrid species within the genus Epilobium, belonging to the family Onagraceae. It is a herbaceous perennial plant characterized by its erect, branching stems and opposite, lanceolate leaves. The plant produces showy, pink to reddish-purple flowers in clusters, typically blooming from late spring to early autumn. It thrives in moist, disturbed soils and is often found in wet meadows, riverbanks, and along roadsides. Epilobium × prantlii is valued for its ornamental appeal and plays a role in supporting local pollinator populations.
